DOC.brief_title: Improving Memory Performance Applying Cognitive Training
DOC.detailed_description: This study test feasibility preliminary efficacy computerized cognitive training program improve work memory decrease impulsivity among HIV-infected individual poor medication adherence . The specific aim : ( 1 ) Investigate effect cognitive training intervention work memory delay discount HIV-infected person ; ( 2 ) Characterize adherence antiretroviral medication population examine medication adherence cognitive training . The research design include two part : eligibility screen Cognitive Training study . In Part 1 , Eligibility Screening , participant complete 2-3 hour battery standardize measure assess study eligibility . Eligible individual invite enroll Part 2 , Cognitive Training Study . Part 1 study involve screen approximately 60 participant , estimate eligibility rate 67 % Part 2 . In Part 2 , participant assign one two group ( active cognitive training control training ; 20 participant per group ) complete 12 training session 10 week . Participants assign active cognitive training group complete computerize module design enhance work memory , assign attention-matched control group complete inactive module design enhance memory . All Part 2 participant complete assessment baseline post-training evaluate impact train program .
